results.title: Foreign Films, English Titles and the Dilemma Distributors Face
results.abstract: Leave as is? Translate? Change altogether? A movie’s success doesn’t depend entirely on what we call it, but it can have a big effect.

multimedia.caption: The dystopian thriller “The Platform” was originally “El Hoyo,” which is “The Hole” in Spanish.
The dystopian thriller “The Platform” was originally “El Hoyo,” which is “The Hole” in Spanish.

results.title: ‘Three Thousand Years of Longing’ Review: Desire, Once Upon a Time
results.abstract: George Miller directs a visually sumptuous, grown-up fairy tale with Tilda Swinton and Idris Elba. It jumps across time but too often just stumbles.

results.title: More Than ‘Weird’: Roku Embraces Original Programming
results.abstract: The streaming media device company wants to attract more viewers and advertisers to its channel. A coming biopic of “Weird Al” Yankovic is its most ambitious project to date.

results.title: ‘Funny Pages’ Review: Ordinary Life, Complex Stuff
results.abstract: Owen Kline’s wonderful feature debut about an aspiring comic-book creator delves into a buzzingly alive, if anxious, world of cartooning.

multimedia.caption: In “Funny Pages,” Daniel Zolghadri plays a young cartoonist, who, though desperate for validation, seems to despise almost everyone.

results.title: Virginia Patton Moss, ‘It’s a Wonderful Life’ Actress, Dies at 97
results.abstract: The last surviving adult member of the film’s cast, she played the sister-in-law to James Stewart’s George Bailey. Three years later, she quit Hollywood.

multimedia.caption: Virginia Patton as Ruth Dakin in “It’s a Wonderful Life” (1946) with, from left, Todd Karns as her husband, Harry; James Stewart as George Bailey, Harry's brother; and Thomas Mitchell as the brothers’ Uncle Billy.

Virginia Patton as Ruth Dakin in “It’s a Wonderful Life” (1946) with, from left, Todd Karns as her husband, Harry; James Stewart as George Bailey, Harry's brother; and Thomas Mitchell as the brothers’ Uncle Billy.

results.title: ‘The Invitation’ Review: Bringing Down the Haunted House
results.abstract: Nathalie Emmanuel stars as the unwitting belle of an English manor in this middling gothic horror movie that leaves her blind to the blood-red flags waving at every turn.

results.abstract: This L.G.B.T.Q. drama from Brazil follows a distraught police academy instructor with a history of violence as he searches for his mysterious online girlfriend.

results.title: ‘Adieu Godard’ Review: A Poor Imitation
results.abstract: This limp satire about an Indian villager’s encounter with the movies of Jean-Luc Godard rehashes regressive stereotypes and squanders a potent premise.

multimedia.caption: Choudhury Bikash Das plays Ananda, an Indian villager who becomes enamored with the cinema of Jean-Luc Godard and organizes a French film festival.

results.title: Can a Start-Up Help the Film and TV Industry Reduce Their Carbon Footprint?
results.abstract: The global entertainment industry generates millions of metric tons of carbon dioxide a year. A Spanish director has set up a company to try to cut that number substantially.

multimedia.caption: Eduardo Vieitez, a Spanish film and advertising director and the creator of the Creast app, which is designed to help productions reduce their carbon footprints.

results.title: Gary Gaines, Coach of ‘Friday Night Lights’ Fame, Dies at 73
results.abstract: He coached the Permian High School Panthers in Odessa, Texas, for four seasons in the 1980s, including the one that became the subject of a best-selling book.

multimedia.caption: Gary Gaines, the head coach of the Permian High School Panthers, at a practice in 2009, the year he returned to Permian. He had a 46-7-1 record there in the 1980s, but he was less successful the second time around.

results.title: ‘Katrina Babies’ Review: Hearing From Survivors
results.abstract: Edward Buckles Jr.’s intimate documentary sheds light on the experiences of Black children when Hurricane Katrina struck New Orleans.

results.title: Joanne Koch, Who Led Lincoln Center’s Film Society, Dies at 92
results.abstract: A lifelong film lover, she stood up to protesters, and to federal and church authorities, to bring challenging movies to the masses.

results.title: Kate Berlant Can’t Hide Any Longer
results.abstract: The experimental comic is known for freewheeling sets. Then Bo Burnham asked, “What if you actually tried to make something?” The transition has been hard.

results.title: Gary Busey Faces Sex Charges After Appearance at Film Convention
results.abstract: The actor, 78, was a featured guest at Monster-Mania Con in Cherry Hill, N.J. He was charged with two counts of criminal sexual contact, among other counts, the police said.

multimedia.caption: The actor Gary Busey, who earned an Oscar nomination for his role in the 1978 film “The Buddy Holly Story,” was charged on Saturday, the police said.
multimedia.copyright: Chris Maggio for The New York Times

results.title: Gene LeBell, 89, Judo Champion, Wrestler and Star Stuntman, Dies
results.abstract: A tough guy who got beaten up by the likes of John Wayne, he had a bottom-line view of his job: “The more you get hit in the nose, the richer you are.”

multimedia.caption: The Hollywood stuntman Gene LeBell in the 1950s, when he was a professional wrestler. He had earlier been an American Amateur Union judo champion.

results.title: Rewriting Women Back Into Film History
